definition: to write a letter (to the authorities)/to present a petition
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Anne closed her book and stood up.
I'm the lady you've looked for, write to me, and escape.
sentences.chinese: 那麼我是阿誰你要找的人，給我上書，咱們一路私逃。

sentences.english: Please close your books immediately and answer these questions.
sentences.chinese: 請立即合上書，回答這些問題。

sentences.english: With this words he shut the book and left the room.
sentences.chinese: 說着他就合上書走出房去。

sentences.english: At the same time Empress Wang sent envoys to Rome …
sentences.chinese: 王太后並曾派人至羅馬上書教皇及耶穌總會長。

sentences.english: They petitioned for an early end to the fighting .
sentences.chinese: 他們上書請求早日結束戰爭。

sentences.english: He closed the book with sharp snap, and looked over at Moroes.
sentences.chinese: 然後猛地合上書，把視線移到了摩洛斯身上。

sentences.english: He was careful to mark his place before he shut the book.
sentences.chinese: 合上書以前，他小心地作了記號。

sentences.english: At the same time Empress Wang sent envoys to Rome for pr…
sentences.chinese: 王太后並曾派人至羅馬上書教皇及耶穌總會長。

definition: worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
to hang or suspend/to worry/public announcement/unresolved/baseless/without foundation
portrait/to do a portrait of sb
Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
general/high-ranking military officer/to check or checkmate/fig. to embarrass/to challenge/to put sb on the spot
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
